page.title: 17HEDGEROWS, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: Hedges have lots of uses.Animals use them for homes and shelter.Farmers need them to divide their land and pen in their livestock.They also prevent the wind from blowing away the top soil.Some farmers,however,would rather remove the hedges to gain more land for their crops.But this would alter the environment and harm wildlife as hedges also play an important part in the food-chain.For example,the loss of hedges would lead to the death of hedge-sparrows and then in turn the extinction of Sparrow-hawks and other birds of prey. The laying of hedges has always been a winter task, partly because the task is easier when there is no foliage. When laying the hawthorn it is trimmed and the main stems are cut half through near the base and then bent over to a low angle.
